definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: You need a spoon to beat the mixture smooth.
sentences.chinese: 你需要用一把調羹來攪均混合液。

sentences.english: Joe clinked his spoon against his glass as everyone took their seats.
sentences.chinese: 當大家就座時，喬用調羹敲了敲玻璃杯。

sentences.english: He dug into the can and measured out a small spoonful of the powder .
sentences.chinese: 他伸手到罐頭裏舀出一小調羹白粉。

sentences.english: The scissors and the basins and the spoons and the fire-trays, of the best gold;
sentences.chinese: 又用精金製造鑷子，盤子，調羹，火鼎。

sentences.english: Give each person a knife and a spoon.
sentences.chinese: 給每人一把刀和一隻調羹。

sentences.english: You also need a saucepan, a spoon and a flask.
sentences.chinese: 你還需要一個平底鍋，一隻調羹和長頸瓶。

sentences.english: The waitress brings me a spoon and knife but no fock.
sentences.chinese: 那個女服務員端來一個調羹和一把餐刀，但沒有X。
